## Developer Guide

If you are new to using `nbdev` here are some useful pointers to get you
started.

### Install yt_utils in Development mode

``` sh
# make sure yt_utils package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to yt_utils
$ nbdev_prepare
```

## Usage

### Installation

Install latest from the GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/renato145/yt-utils):

``` sh
$ pip install git+https://github.com/renato145/yt-utils.git
```

or from [conda](https://anaconda.org/renato145/yt-utils)

``` sh
$ conda install -c renato145 yt_utils
```

or from [pypi](https://pypi.org/project/yt-utils/)

``` sh
$ pip install yt_utils
```

### Documentation

Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/renato145/yt-utils)’s
[pages](https://renato145.github.io/yt-utils/). Additionally you can
find package manager specific guidelines on
[conda](https://anaconda.org/renato145/yt-utils) and
[pypi](https://pypi.org/project/yt-utils/) respectively.
